required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Energy Density on Self-served Snacks in Preschool Children
clinical_study.official_title: Self-served Snack Study for Preschool Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine whether the energy density of snack foods affects the amounts that preschool children serve themselves and then consume. We will serve snacks that vary in energy density to preschool children in their childcare centers and measure the amount they serve themselves and consume. The results will have implications for guidance about the provision of snacks for preschool children and may help in identifying strategies for the prevention of obesity in children.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in the weight of self-served snack food
primary_outcome.description: Weight served of snack food in grams

primary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in the weight of snack food consumed
primary_outcome.description: Weight consumed of snack food in grams

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in the volume of self-served snack food
secondary_outcome.description: Volume served of snack food in milliliters (ml)

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in the volume of snack food consumed
secondary_outcome.description: Volume consumed of snack food in milliliters (ml)

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in the energy of self-served snack food
secondary_outcome.description: Energy served of snack food in kilocalories (kcal)

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference between interventions in the energy of snack food consumed
secondary_outcome.description: Energy consumed of snack food in kilocalories (kcal)

arm_group.description: Test snack with lower-energy-dense snack food
Test snack with higher-energy-dense snack food

intervention.intervention_name: Snack with energy density less than 1.5 kcal/g
intervention.description: Snack meal with snack food having energy density less than 1.5 kcal/g

intervention.intervention_name: Snack with energy density greater than 1.5 kcal/g
intervention.description: Snack meal with snack food having energy density greater than 1.5 kcal/g

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children who are enrolled in a scheduled classroom of the participating childcare centers
- Children who are between the ages of 4 and 6 years old at the time of enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children who have tested positive or are showing symptoms of COVID-19, or have recently had potential exposure with a person with COVID-19
- Children who are allergic to any of the foods served
- Children whose diets exclude any of the foods served
- Children who are absent from the childcare center on the acclimation day or both study days
- Children who are not able to serve themselves the two foods that are provided during the acclimation day

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Nutrition and Director of the Laboratory for the Study of Human Ingestive Behavior
